common.dataStructures

Class UnionFind<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.dataStructures.UnionFind<E>

  • public class UnionFind<E>
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UnionFind()
      Constructs an empty UnionFind data structure
      UnionFind(java.util.Set<E> elms)
      Constructs a UnionFind data structure initially containing the given elements.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(E e)
      Adds the given element to this union find, if not already present.
      E find(E elm)
      Returns the element at the top of elm's union.
      boolean isUnion(E elm1, E elm2)
      Returns true iff elm1 and elm2 are currently unioned in this UnionFind.
      int size(E elm)
      Returns the size of the union that elm is contained in.
      java.util.Set<E> toElmSet()
      Returns a set of the elements contained in this UnionFind
      java.util.Set<java.util.Set<E>> toUnionSet()
      Returns a set of sets of elements.
      E union(E elm1, E elm2)
      Unions the two elements.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • UnionFind

        public UnionFind()
        Constructs an empty UnionFind data structure

      • UnionFind

        public UnionFind(java.util.Set<E> elms)
        Constructs a UnionFind data structure initially containing the given elements. Each element is placed in its own union (with size 1).

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(E e)
        Adds the given element to this union find, if not already present. If this addition is performed, places it in its own union with size 1.
        Parameters:
        e - - the element to add
        Returns:
        - true if the UnionFind was altered as a result of this operation.

      • toElmSet

        public java.util.Set<E> toElmSet()
        Returns a set of the elements contained in this UnionFind

      • toUnionSet

        public java.util.Set<java.util.Set<E>> toUnionSet()
        Returns a set of sets of elements. Each subset is a union in the UnionFind

      • find

        public E find(E elm)
       throws NotInCollectionException
        Returns the element at the top of elm's union. Runs in O(1) amortized time because of compression applied after the operation. (O(logN) in worst case).
        Throws:
        NotInCollectionException - - if elm is not in this UnionFind

      • size

        public int size(E elm)
         throws NotInCollectionException
        Returns the size of the union that elm is contained in. Runs in O(1) amortized time. (O(logN) in worst case).
        Throws:
        NotInCollectionException - - if elm is not in this UnionFind

      • union

        public E union(E elm1,
               E elm2)
        throws NotInCollectionException
        Unions the two elements. If they are already unioned, does not change anything
        Parameters:
        elm1 - - the first element to union
        elm2 - - the second element to union
        Returns:
        - the element that is the parent of the union. If the two elements were already unioned, returns elm1.
        Throws:
        NotInCollectionException - - if elm1 or elm2 are not in the collection.

      • isUnion

        public boolean isUnion(E elm1,
                       E elm2)
                throws NotInCollectionException
        Returns true iff elm1 and elm2 are currently unioned in this UnionFind.
        Throws:
        NotInCollectionException - - if elm1 or elm2 are not in this UnionFind.
